description: Students explore an interdisciplinary topic in language, literature, history, or culture
through close reading, discussion, analysis, and interpretation of selected works,
including theoretical texts.  Sample topics include: the Germans in exile, the
German-American heritage, the German Holocaust, Germany in the European Union, and
Germanic myths. Taught in German. May be counted toward German major or German studies
concentration.  Counts towards medieval studies major. May be repeated if topics are different.
